title.narrative: Technical Support To Solid Waste Management In Addis Ababa: Implementation Of The Fukuoka Method

description.narrative:
The purpose of this project is to provide technical support to Addis Ababa City Administration to urgently respond to the highly dangerous current situation of the solid waste management system in the city by applying the Fukuoka Method as urgent and sustainable solution.UN-Habitat has supported a number of projects and programmes in Ethiopia since 1998 including water and sanitation, urban profiling, urban mobility, capacity building. Recent projects in Addis Ababa include the State of Addis Ababa 2017 Report, Technical support to development of the Bus Rapid Transport (BRT), a Public Space project and the development of the Resilience Framework for Action for Lideta sub-city.
Importantly, in November 2016, a MoU was signed between UN-Habitat and the Addis Ababa City Administration, in which provision of technical support for improved SWM is highlighted as key area of collaboration.
Further, the proposed project clearly aligns with UN-Habitat Country programme Document for Ethiopia.
In addition, based on its long term global agreement with the Fukuoka University, UN-Habitat has been advocating for and implementing the Fukuoka Method as a solution to the challenges of Solid Waste Management in several cities in the world.
Considering the existing strong collaboration with the Addis Ababa city Government, UN-Habitat is well positioned to provide adequate response to the current situation in Addis Ababa, in order to quickly decrease the level of dangerousness of the old dump site.

title.narrative: Risks related to landslides, fires and environmental pollution are reduced for inhabitants of Nifas Silk Lafto sub-city, located near Koshe dumpsite

description.narrative: Risks related to landslides, fires and environmental pollution are reduced for inhabitants of Nifas Silk Lafto sub-city, located near Koshe dumpsite

baseline.value: The current angle of the slopes at Koshe are steep up to 45 degrees.

target.value: `Generally in a dump site sanitary landfill, the slopes must be designed and managed to be 30 degrees or less in order to avoid landslides

baseline.value: Present concentration of leachate percolates into the soil, putting also ground waters at risk. The assessment included in this project will quantify the present concentration of leachate.

target.value: The concentration of leachate, in parameters such as in BOD, should reduce by at least 50% in one year, and up to 70-80% in 2 years

baseline.value: Fires and explosions relate to the generation of methane gas. This is due to the anaerobic state of accumulated waste over the years. At the present state, in the dump site there is no ventilation system to decrease the emission of methane gas

target.value: The installation of pipes required by the implementation of the Fukuoka Method, in general terms, will reduce the emission of methane gas by 40%.
